intro: Navarretia valdiviensis, commonly known as the Valdivia navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Chile. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils along the Pacific coast, where it thrives in the cool, moist climate. Navarretia valdiviensis is a perennial species that produces small, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in coastal scrub habitats. Its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements make it a notable example of plant adaptation to coastal environments.
